page.title: 19LIFE IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: Within the home there is much interest in cooking, wine making and household crafts. Preserves, bakery etc. are sold at W.I. market in Leominster. Needlework, embroidery and knitting, painting and pottery are other activities. There is great support for local charitable events, e.g. "Water for India" (Â£900), Cancer Treatment (Â£1300). Twenty households do not own a car and 20 are on well water. Work of residents employed outside the block include banking, horse-training, domestic work, quarrying, local authority and water board employees, civil engineer, artist, social worker, journalist, vet., aircraft engineer, engine driver, lorry driver, steel erector, calf dealer, chief executive of the district council, secretary, agricultural suppliers, factory worker
